title: Human Scent Camouflage
brief: Mask human odors to avoid detection by animals and enemy trackers.
steps: Step 1: Wash yourself and clothes without soap to remove soap and body odors.
Step 2: Avoid strong smelling foods like garlic that increase body odors.
Step 3: Do not use tobacco, candy, gum, or cosmetics.
Step 4: Use aromatic herbs or plants (pine needles, mint) to wash body and clothing.
Step 5: Rub aromatic plants on body and clothing for scent camouflage.
Step 6: Chew aromatic plants to camouflage breath odor.
Step 7: Stand in older smoke from fires to mask scent - avoid fresh smoke.
warnings: Animals are afraid of fresh fire smoke but accept older smoke scents as natural.
Strong human odors can be detected from great distances depending on wind.
Soap and cosmetic odors are distinctly human and will alert both animals and people.
Consider wind direction when approaching humans or animals.
